result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R. Tucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report immediately to Probation upon release.
Concurrent with: Probation in case 15CM183 and with Count 2 in this same case as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
The defendant shall have no contact with Rebecca Lerche  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Contact may be allowed at the agent's discretion and with the victim's permission.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant was granted 52 days credit for time served.  Jail sentence is on Ct 2 only.
Concurrent with: Jail sentence on Ct 2 in case 15CM183

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was granted 244 days credit for time served.
Consecutive to: Jail sentences in cases 16CM121,15CM183, 15CM221 and 15CM191 are all consecutive to each other
Concurrent with: Jail sentence on Ct 4 in this same case

All costs and fees reduced to a civil judgment   Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Concurrent with: Probation in case 15CM183 and with Ct 2 in this same case
